name: tomatillo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a small green or purple-green fruit similar to a tomato, used raw or cooked in Mexican cooking, especially to make salsa verde (= a spicy green sauce made with raw vegetables): A tomatillo is a vegetable that resembles a small green tomato. Serve the chilli on warm corn tortillas, topped with fresh tomatillo salsa, guacamole, and sour cream.
Daniel Sambraus/Photographer's Choice RF/GettyImages
[ C ] the Mexican plant on which tomatillos grow: My tomatillos have produced a lot of fruit this year.
Barbara Rich/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe sea-bass was served with a salad of preserved lemon, tomatillo, and quinoa.In a bowl combine tomatoes, tomatillos, cucumber, jalapeno pepper, green onions, garlic, lime juice and cilantro.Green salsa is based on the tomatillo, which is a relative of the tomato.In the yard, tomatillo plants grow between rows of peppers, tomatoes and cabbages.The tomatillo grows best in full sun.
